column4: re your earlier question, you can use ANY truetype fonts.  they go on ~/.fonts
if you put them in ~/.fonts, only YOU will have access, in /usr/share/fonts, everyone who uses the puter has access
there are many types of fonts, type1 are adobe style, i believe
linukso was suggesting some order to your font collection, you can have fonts directly under /truetype/ or in folders of descriptive names
should one care about organizing their new fonts? is there a mess if we just put all new fonts into one folder?
some users like to keep the fonts they collect in some type of order (by d/l site, by style of font, etc) it is all up to you
any time you are not in your ~/  folder, you need root permission to write things
how do i give myself permission?
you can name it what you like, just use "sudo"
it is NOT advised you let nautilus have root priveleges (it can really mess up your user space)
can it? in that case, i'll do the "sudo mkdir" method ,then.
learning the terminal is a good investment in time
use the "cp" command with sudo  (in a terminal, type "man cp" for basic usage)
is there a way to give my new subfolder write/copy permission? and is it safe?
the permissions are the filesystem the way they are for security reasons (malicious code, malicious people, etc)
